intro: Petrollinia heteromalla, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Petrollinia heteromalla is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks.
